content.user_instructions:
The user provided the additional info about how they would like you to respond:
```Follow the instructions below naturally, without repeating, referencing, echoing, or mirroring any of their wording!

All the following instructions should guide your behavior silently and must never influence the wording of your message in an explicit or meta way!

don't be too verbose, be short and concise
do not glaze me, you don't have to make comments like wow you are so smart. 
just be informational and direct. 
Adopt a skeptical, questioning approach.```

entries.title: Meta's AI translation tool can dub your Instagram videos
entries.snippet: Meta is expanding its AI translation tool to more users on Facebook and Instagram, allowing automatic dubbing of reels between English and Spanish. The tool utilizes AI to generate voiceovers matching the user’s voice and mouth movements. To use it, creators can activate the "Translate voices with Meta AI" toggle before publishing a reel. The feature also supports optional lip-syncing and allows review before sharing. Translated reels are automatically shown to users in their preferred language and are marked with a disclosure tag indicating AI translation. The rollout is currently available to Facebook creators with at least 1,000 followers and all public Instagram accounts.

entries.title: Meta's AI translation remakes Reels in your language
entries.snippet:
Meta has introduced a new AI-powered feature that automatically translates, dubs, and lip-syncs Reels on Facebook and Instagram into different languages, currently supporting English, Spanish, Hindi, and Portuguese. This enhancement allows users to experience videos as if they were originally created in their native language, complete with voice cloning that mimics the original speaker’s tone and cadence, and optional lip-syncing for added realism. While this service isn't available for all users, Facebook creators with over 1,000 followers and all public Instagram accounts in supported countries can access the feature for free.

Clearly labeled with a "Translated with Meta AI" tag, viewers have the option to disable translations or keep the original audio. This move builds on Meta’s history of multilingual content tools like auto-captions and subtitled Stories. However, it marks the company’s first use of AI for voice cloning and lip-syncing, giving Meta a potential advantage over competitors like YouTube and TikTok, who offer translation overlays and captions but not real-time dubbing with voice sync. The innovation aims to make short-form content more globally accessible and culturally inclusive.

entries.title: Otter.ai App Adds French and Spanish Transcription: What You Need to Know
entries.snippet:
Otter.ai has expanded its capabilities by adding real-time transcription support for French and Spanish, in addition to English. The app, available on both Android and iOS, allows users to record and transcribe meetings and conversations directly from their mobile device or through a web interface that integrates with platforms like Zoom, Microsoft Teams, and Google Meet. However, it does not offer translation services, so users must be fluent in the chosen language.

The app is free with a Basic plan offering 300 transcription minutes per month (30 minutes per conversation) and limits to three imported files. The Pro plan, costing $16.99/month or $100 annually, raises these limits to 1200 minutes per month, 90 minutes per conversation, and up to 10 imported files. Business and Enterprise plans are also available for users needing more extensive features. Users can edit transcriptions to correct any errors.

entries.title: Whisper (speech recognition system)
Facebook-parent Meta unveils AI voice translations for Reels, starting with English and Spanish
entries.snippet: Meta has launched a new AI-powered translation feature for content creators on Facebook and Instagram Reels. The tool, known as Meta AI translations, initially supports English and Spanish and aims to include more languages in the future. It allows creators to automatically dub and lip-sync their videos into another language, facilitating better global reach and accessibility. According to Meta, the feature is free and helps users connect with international audiences more effectively by delivering content in the viewer's native language. This innovation is expected to significantly enhance creators' ability to grow global followings.

entries.title: Save $300 on AI caption and transcription platform Joyspace, now $79.99
entries.snippet:
The article promotes a significant discount on a lifetime subscription to Joyspace, an AI-powered captioning and transcription platform, now available for $79.99 (originally $379). Joyspace allows users to automatically generate captions for videos and transcribe recordings or podcasts using AI. With the Essential Plan, subscribers receive 80 minutes of transcription and 160 credits per month, as well as a 45-minute video export limit.

The plan also includes features such as watermark-free video, downloadable transcripts, instant captions, unlimited downloads and templates, and access to B-roll media like images and GIFs. Supporting 35 languages, Joyspace makes it easy to work with multi-lingual content without needing bilingual services. The platform allows customization of captions to match brand aesthetics and offers tools like animated emojis and timing adjustments for readability.

Beyond accessibility for the hearing-impaired, captions support silent viewing and content virality. Joyspace aims to streamline content creation for webinars, podcasts, and videos, helping creators maximize reach and user engagement.
